contentrichtext.text: {{primarysources|date=August 2009}} The '''Qatar Financial Centre''' (QFC) is a business and financial centre located in [[Doha]], providing legal and business infrastructure for financial services. It was established in March 2005. The Qatar Financial Centre provides financial institutions with a world class financial services platform situated in an economy founded on the development of its hydrocarbons resources. It has been created with a long-term perspective to support the [[Economic development|development]] of Qatar and the [[Arabian Peninsula|wider region]], develop local and regional markets, and strengthen the links between the [[Petroleum industry|energy]] based economies and global [[financial market]]s. == Background == While [[Petroleum|oil]] and [[Natural gas|gas]] will probably remain the backbone of Qatar's economy for some time to come, the country seeks to stimulate the private sector and develop a [[knowledge economy]]. In 2004, it established the [[Qatar Science & Technology Park]] to attract and serve [[technology]]-based companies and entrepreneurs, from overseas and within Qatar. Qatar also established "education city" which consists of international colleges. For the 15th Asian Games in Doha in December 2006 it established a "sports city" consisting of Khalifa stadium, the [[ASPIRE Academy for Sports Excellence|Aspire Sports Academy]], aquatic centres, exhibition centres and many other sports related buildings and centres. Qatar also plans to build an "entertainment city" in the future. Apart from Qatar itself, which needs to raise the capacity of its [[financial services]] to support more than $140 billion worth of projects, the QFC also provides a conduit for [[financial services]] providers to access nearly $1 trillion of investment across the [[Cooperation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf|GCC]] as a whole over the next decade. ==See also== *[[Economy of Qatar]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.qfc.com.qa/ Qatar Financial Centre Authority] *[http://www.qfcra.com/ Qatar Financial Centre Regulatory Authority] *[http://www.qfba.edu.qa/ Qatar Finance and Business Academy] *[http://www.qatarlyst.com/ Qatarlyst] [[Category:Economy of Qatar]] [[Category:Business organizations]] [[Category:Financial services companies of Qatar]] [[Category:2005 establishments in Qatar]]
